article.title: Constraining self-interacting dark matter with scaling laws of observed halo surface densities

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the vertical dashed line in Figure 1 represent?
choices: The radius of efficient self-interaction, rSIDM.

multiple_choice_question.text: What kind of objects are represented by the magenta circles in Figure 2?
What quantity is plotted on the y-axis of both panels in Figure 3?
choices: The surface density at the core radius, Σc, obs.
The average density inside rSIDM, ρSIDM.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4 shows the dependence of rSIDM and ρSIDM on the self-interaction cross section for three different halo masses. Which halo mass is represented by the blue lines?
What do the red points in Figure 5 represent?
choices: Observational data of the surface density.
Theoretical prediction of the surface density for SIDM.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 6 shows the log-likelihood ratio as a function of the effective cross section. Which line represents the likelihood based only on dwarf galaxies?
What does the parameter ξ represent in Figure 7?
choices: The ratio of the core radius to the scale radius.
The ratio of the average densities inside rSIDM and rc.
The ratio of the reconstructed cross section to the true cross section.
The logarithmic slope of the density profile at rSIDM.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the gray line represent in Figure 8?
choices: Observational data of the velocity dispersion.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the dotted vertical line represent in Figure 9?
choices: The radius of efficient self-interaction, rSIDM.

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 10 depicts the halo age as a function of virial mass. What is the approximate halo age for a virial mass of 10^12 solar masses?
